title: [Snyk] SNYK-JS-MDASTUTILTOHAST-14157221 in mdast-util-to-hast@13.2.0
description:
## Improperly Controlled Modification of Dynamically-Determined Object Attributes

**Severity:** medium
**Package:** mdast-util-to-hast@13.2.0
**File:** `dashboard/package.json`

**CVSS Score:** 6.9  
**Snyk Priority Score:** 345/1000

### CVEs
- [CVE-2025-66400](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-66400)

**Fix:** Upgrade `mdast-util-to-hast` to version 13.2.1 or later.

### Details
## Overview
[mdast-util-to-hast](https://www.npmjs.org/package/mdast-util-to-hast) is a mdast utility to transform to hast

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improperly Controlled Modification of Dynamically-Determined Object Attributes in the `class` attribute in rendered markdown `code` elements. An attacker can cause arbitrary CSS classes to be applied to elements by injecting specially crafted character references, altering the appearance or behavior of rendered content.
## Remediation
Upgrade `mdast-util-to-hast` to version 13.2.1 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/syntax-tree/mdast-util-to-hast/commit/6fc783ae6abdeb798fd5a68e7f3f21411dde7403)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/syntax-tree/mdast-util-to-hast/commit/ab3a79570a1afbfa7efef5d4a0cd9b5caafbc5d7)


### Reference
- [Snyk advisory](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-MDASTUTILTOHAST-14157221)
